sentence.Network_en: Sontag has always been that rarity, a glamorous intellectual.
sentence.Network_cn: 桑塔格一直是那种兼具美貌与智慧的人中龙凤。

sentence.Network_en: Smoking is still attractive to many young people who see it as glamorous.
sentence.Network_cn: 吸烟对很多年轻人还是很有诱惑力，他们觉得这让自己显得魅力十足。

sentence.Network_en: I thought it would be glamorous but I just turned out to be a general dogsbody.
sentence.Network_cn: 我以为那会是个美差，结果我成了一个打杂的。

entry.tran: 富有魅力的；迷人的；令人向往的
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as glamorous, you mean that they are more attractive, exciting, or interesting than ordinary people or things.

example.ex: ...some of the world's most beautiful and glamorous women...
example.tran: 全世界最漂亮迷人的一些女性

example.ex: The south coast is less glamorous but full of clean and attractive hotels.
example.tran: 南海岸魅力稍逊，但却有很多干净漂亮的宾馆。

means.word_mean: 1. having an air of allure, romance and excitement;
